author: TimN-aus
post_text: October 4, 2015 at 5:06 AM#1Is it possible to make a macro that will change the priority of an executer?

posts.author: TimN-aus
posts.post_text: October 4, 2015 at 5:06 AM#1Is it possible to make a macro that will change the priority of an executer?

posts.author: ivers
posts.post_text: October 4, 2015 at 6:11 AM#2Yep.CodeAssign /priority=X @where X is HTP, LTP or whatever will work for sequences. Just fire the macro and the exec button for the given executor.CodeAssign exec (Which exec?) /priority=Xwill give you a popup where you can specify executor.I can not get this to work with effects though.

posts.author: HillaryKnox
posts.post_text: October 5, 2015 at 8:26 PM#3So I got this to work, but only for X=htp, X=low, and X=normal (which is LTP I discovered). What is the fill-in-the-blanks answer for High?

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: October 5, 2015 at 9:41 PM#4Lol. It's "hight" - gotta love those typos./priority=swap sets it to Swp. Currently, to set a priority of "Super" (v3.1+ only), you have to say /priority=0; ="super" doesn't work at the moment.

posts.author: HillaryKnox
posts.post_text: October 7, 2015 at 7:25 PM#5Thanks for that.Speaking of Assign & command line / macros, is there a comprehensive syntax list of changing Assign menu items from the command line and/or macros? Because I have (& I imagine others have) only about 5 different combinations of Assign menu stuff that covers about 90% of the things I do. It would be handy to be able to make 5 macros that, well, you see where I'm going with this...Come to think of it, in a larger general sense, is there some kind of omnibus command line syntax reference that covers, well, pretty much anything and everything you can do via command line?Edit: and then I found this:https://app.teamsupport.com/wiki/justartic…ArticleID=28154

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: October 7, 2015 at 9:46 PM#6HillaryKnox Wrote:-------------------------------------------------------> Edit: and then I found this:>app.teamsupport.comI'm working on it. Hopefully after LDI I'll have time to add some more stuff.

title: Change priority macro
